title: 'Petty, partisan, un-American': Social media on Harris-Biden not congratulating Elon Musk on SpaceX feat
content: Elon Musk had a clash with California as it rejected Elon Musk' request for more frequent SpaceX launches from the state's central coast and it cited Elon Musk's politics as the reason for the rejection. The California Coastal Commission on Thursday voted 6-4 against the US Space Force's request to allow SpaceX to increase the number of launches of its Falcon 9 rocket at Vandenberg Space Force Base from 36 to 50 a year.
summary: Elon Musk had a clash with California as it rejected Elon Musk' request for more frequent SpaceX launches from the state's central coast and it cited Elon Musk's politics as the reason for the rejection. The California Coastal Commission on Thursday voted 6-4 against the US Space Force's request to allow SpaceX to increase the number of launches of its Falcon 9 rocket at Vandenberg Space Force Base from 36 to 50 a year.

title: Trump asks Harris to pass cognitive stamina test amid row over medical report: 'Slow and lethargic'
content: Instead of releasing his medical records, Donald Trump questioned Kamala Harris' cognitive stamina and agility and said something is very wrong with her as she is slow and lethargic in answering even the easiest of questions. Trump's post came as Kamala Harris released her medical report in which she has been declared fit for the role of the president.
summary: Instead of releasing his medical records, Donald Trump questioned Kamala Harris' cognitive stamina and agility and said something is very wrong with her as she is slow and lethargic in answering even the easiest of questions. Trump's post came as Kamala Harris released her medical report in which she has been declared fit for the role of the president.

title: Pakistan to repay over $30 billion debt in FY25, says central bank
content: Pakistan is set to repay USD 30.35 billion in foreign debt and interest from August 2024 to July 2025, significantly higher than the previous year's repayments. The country’s foreign debt-to-GDP ratio has decreased, but the rising repayments highlight the need for strategies to boost foreign income and reduce expenditures.
summary: Pakistan is set to repay USD 30.35 billion in foreign debt and interest from August 2024 to July 2025, significantly higher than the previous year's repayments. The country’s foreign debt-to-GDP ratio has decreased, but the rising repayments highlight the need for strategies to boost foreign income and reduce expenditures.

title: Trump calls Chinese President Xi 'brilliant,' says US faces greater threats from 'enemies within'
content: Donald Trump renewed praise for Chinese President Xi Jinping, calling him 'fierce' and 'smart.' Despite historical US-China trade tensions, Trump described their relationship as strong. The ex-president's affinity for authoritarian leaders also includes Vladimir Putin, with whom he reportedly had secret discussions, stirring debates about his foreign diplomacy and potential risks to US interests.
summary: Donald Trump renewed praise for Chinese President Xi Jinping, calling him 'fierce' and 'smart.' Despite historical US-China trade tensions, Trump described their relationship as strong. The ex-president's affinity for authoritarian leaders also includes Vladimir Putin, with whom he reportedly had secret discussions, stirring debates about his foreign diplomacy and potential risks to US interests.

title: '100% Trump supporter': Man arrested with loaded guns near Coachella rally denies assassination intent
content: An armed man, Vem Miller, was arrested near Trump's Coachella rally but denies assassination intentions, claiming to be a Trump supporter. He asserts that the firearms were for personal protection due to past threats. Fake IDs found with him were explained as legitimate documents for safety reasons.
summary: An armed man, Vem Miller, was arrested near Trump's Coachella rally but denies assassination intentions, claiming to be a Trump supporter. He asserts that the firearms were for personal protection due to past threats. Fake IDs found with him were explained as legitimate documents for safety reasons.

title: Climber Sandy Irvine’s remains found on Mount Everest after 100 years
content: A National Geographic team discovers a preserved boot with Andrew Irvine's name on it, providing significant evidence in solving the nearly 100-year-old mystery of Irvine and Mallory's ill-fated 1924 Everest expedition. This may offer closure to Irvine's family and new insights into early Everest exploration.
summary: A National Geographic team discovers a preserved boot with Andrew Irvine's name on it, providing significant evidence in solving the nearly 100-year-old mystery of Irvine and Mallory's ill-fated 1924 Everest expedition. This may offer closure to Irvine's family and new insights into early Everest exploration.

title: Will US have peaceful elections? Trump warns of 'very bad, sick people'
content: Former President Donald Trump suggested the potential need for military intervention on Election Day to address internal threats. He dismissed concerns about unrest from his supporters but highlighted worries about 'radical left lunatics' and external agitators, suggesting the National Guard or military might be necessary.
summary: Former President Donald Trump suggested the potential need for military intervention on Election Day to address internal threats. He dismissed concerns about unrest from his supporters but highlighted worries about 'radical left lunatics' and external agitators, suggesting the National Guard or military might be necessary.

title: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan's sisters shifted to Jhelum jail on judicial remand
content: Aleema and Uzma Khan, sisters of ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan, are moved to Jhelum Jail after an anti-terrorism court denies extended physical remand in a high-security environment. The court schedules a bail hearing for October 19, questioning police procedural conduct and the necessity of further evidence collection.
summary: Aleema and Uzma Khan, sisters of ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan, are moved to Jhelum Jail after an anti-terrorism court denies extended physical remand in a high-security environment. The court schedules a bail hearing for October 19, questioning police procedural conduct and the necessity of further evidence collection.

title: 'Defend this holy land': Hezbollah airs audio recording of leader Hassan Nasrallah after his death
content: Hezbollah released an audio recording of its slain leader Hassan Nasrallah, urging fighters to defend Lebanon, following his death by an Israeli air strike. Amid escalating tensions, a drone attack injured 20 in Israel, and the US is sending an anti-missile system to support Israel. The UAE launched an aid campaign for Lebanon.
summary: Hezbollah released an audio recording of its slain leader Hassan Nasrallah, urging fighters to defend Lebanon, following his death by an Israeli air strike. Amid escalating tensions, a drone attack injured 20 in Israel, and the US is sending an anti-missile system to support Israel. The UAE launched an aid campaign for Lebanon.

title: 'I am concerned about...': James Clyburn on Black men supporting Trump in 2024 elections
content: United States Representative James Clyburn raises alarms over potential Black male voter apathy or support for Donald Trump, echoing former President Barack Obama's call to action. While Clyburn campaigns for Kamala Harris, addressing this demographic’s concerns remains a priority for Democrats.
summary: United States Representative James Clyburn raises alarms over potential Black male voter apathy or support for Donald Trump, echoing former President Barack Obama's call to action. While Clyburn campaigns for Kamala Harris, addressing this demographic’s concerns remains a priority for Democrats.

title: 'Martha, do you hear yourself?': JD Vance confronts ABC host over migrant gang presence in Colorado
content: Former President Donald Trump's VP candidate, JD Vance, clashed with ABC News' Martha Raddatz over Trump's claims about Venezuelan migrant gang activity in Aurora, Colorado. Vance argued the situation highlights security concerns, while Aurora's mayor disputed the extent of the gang's impact.
summary: Former President Donald Trump's VP candidate, JD Vance, clashed with ABC News' Martha Raddatz over Trump's claims about Venezuelan migrant gang activity in Aurora, Colorado. Vance argued the situation highlights security concerns, while Aurora's mayor disputed the extent of the gang's impact.

title: Third assassination attempt on Donald Trump? Armed man arrested from Coachella
content: The suspect has been identified as Vem Miller who was carrying a fake press card and entry pass. He is believed to be a member of a rightwing anti-government organization and was plotting to kill Trump, the Sheriff said. "They were different enough to cause the deputies alarm," Bianco said.
summary: The suspect has been identified as Vem Miller who was carrying a fake press card and entry pass. He is believed to be a member of a rightwing anti-government organization and was plotting to kill Trump, the Sheriff said. "They were different enough to cause the deputies alarm," Bianco said.

title: Trump says US citizens 'should be easily handled by military if necessary'
content: ​"We have two enemies: We have the outside enemy, and then we have the enemy from within. And the enemy from within, in my opinion, is more dangerous than China, Russia and all these countries," Trump said. "It should be easily handled by, if necessary, by the National Guard, or if really necessary, by the military," Trump said.
summary: ​"We have two enemies: We have the outside enemy, and then we have the enemy from within. And the enemy from within, in my opinion, is more dangerous than China, Russia and all these countries," Trump said. "It should be easily handled by, if necessary, by the National Guard, or if really necessary, by the military," Trump said.

title: UFO drones are spying on US military bases: Why can't the Pentagon stop them?
content: Mysterious drones have been surveilling sensitive US military sites in Virginia and Nevada, including Naval Station Norfolk. Federal laws and risks prevent the military from shooting them down or jamming their signals. Investigations are ongoing, with suspicions of foreign involvement but no official identification yet.
summary: Mysterious drones have been surveilling sensitive US military sites in Virginia and Nevada, including Naval Station Norfolk. Federal laws and risks prevent the military from shooting them down or jamming their signals. Investigations are ongoing, with suspicions of foreign involvement but no official identification yet.

title: 'Yes, I do regret it': Liz Cheney on her past support for Donald Trump
content: Liz Cheney expresses regret over supporting Donald Trump and endorses Kamala Harris for the 2024 presidential race. Cheney, a vocal critic of Trump post-January 6, also campaigns with Harris, marking significant Republican defiance of former party lines.
summary: Liz Cheney expresses regret over supporting Donald Trump and endorses Kamala Harris for the 2024 presidential race. Cheney, a vocal critic of Trump post-January 6, also campaigns with Harris, marking significant Republican defiance of former party lines.

title: Watch: Elon Musk explains how SpaceX's Mechazilla can catch Super Heavy booster
content: SpaceX successfully flew a 233-foot rocket booster back to its launch site and caught it mid-air using Mechazilla's mechanical arms. The Super Heavy Booster, weighing about 250 tons, was captured after a test flight. "When the engines land... it's gonna drop the velocity to basically zero and come in between the arms. The arms will be wide, and as it's coming in, the arms will, will close, go flush against the side of the vehicle, and the vehicle will be descending through the arms. The probability is uncertain, but it is above zero," Elon explained.
summary: SpaceX successfully flew a 233-foot rocket booster back to its launch site and caught it mid-air using Mechazilla's mechanical arms. The Super Heavy Booster, weighing about 250 tons, was captured after a test flight. "When the engines land... it's gonna drop the velocity to basically zero and come in between the arms. The arms will be wide, and as it's coming in, the arms will, will close, go flush against the side of the vehicle, and the vehicle will be descending through the arms. The probability is uncertain, but it is above zero," Elon explained.

title: 'It’s time to pick a side': Dennis Quaid, ‘Reagan’ actor, rallies for Donald Trump in California
content: Actor Dennis Quaid, advocating for former President Donald Trump, spoke in Coachella, California, urging the crowd to choose between supporting the Constitution or modern trends like TikTok. He drew parallels between Reagan's and Trump's eras, critiquing current policies under Biden and praised Trump's past achievements.
summary: Actor Dennis Quaid, advocating for former President Donald Trump, spoke in Coachella, California, urging the crowd to choose between supporting the Constitution or modern trends like TikTok. He drew parallels between Reagan's and Trump's eras, critiquing current policies under Biden and praised Trump's past achievements.

title: Watch: IDF uncovers underground shaft, captures Hezbollah terrorist
content: The Israeli military has discovered a Hezbollah tunnel shaft in southern Lebanon, leading to an underground bunker containing weapons and supplies. A Hezbollah operative, found inside, surrendered and has been detained for interrogation. The tunnel, extending 50 square meters at a depth of seven meters, was designed for prolonged underground use.
summary: The Israeli military has discovered a Hezbollah tunnel shaft in southern Lebanon, leading to an underground bunker containing weapons and supplies. A Hezbollah operative, found inside, surrendered and has been detained for interrogation. The tunnel, extending 50 square meters at a depth of seven meters, was designed for prolonged underground use.

title: What! Documentary claims King Charles piloted a UFO in 1975!
content: The King of UFOs explores the British Royal Family's interest in UFOs and the paranormal and it has an interview of a person who claims to be an eyewitness to King Charles piloting a UFO in Canada in 1975. The maker of the film Christopher Lee said the claims might be quite far-fetched but it does seem possible after his research work.
summary: The King of UFOs explores the British Royal Family's interest in UFOs and the paranormal and it has an interview of a person who claims to be an eyewitness to King Charles piloting a UFO in Canada in 1975. The maker of the film Christopher Lee said the claims might be quite far-fetched but it does seem possible after his research work.

title: Donald Trump hints at this role for Elon Musk if he wins the presidency again...
content: Elon Musk could assume the role of 'Secretary of Cost-Cutting' in a potential Trump administration, focusing on efficiency. Trump lauded Musk's business acumen and space ambitions. Musk actively campaigns for Trump, emphasizing free speech concerns and advocating against a Kamala Harris presidency.
summary: Elon Musk could assume the role of 'Secretary of Cost-Cutting' in a potential Trump administration, focusing on efficiency. Trump lauded Musk's business acumen and space ambitions. Musk actively campaigns for Trump, emphasizing free speech concerns and advocating against a Kamala Harris presidency.
